Replies.Reply: We are making our final approach to Miami International airport.
It's been our mission statement since we first opened our doors in nineteen twenty three...
Five six. Brown eyes, hazel really, dark hair, thick, shiny...
Cat! Is your homework finished yet?
You draw beautifully my love, but if you want to be something in life you have to study.
Better to be a doctor. A lawyer.
I don't know. Just waiting to hear from your father.
I am studying Mama. I want to be a super hero.
Are we going to see Uncle Emilio?
I don't know. A long time ago.
I used to want to be like Lara. A super agent.
I want to be a killer.
Are you trying to scare me?
I've already been to school. I told you what I want to be. You don't want to help me, fine. I'll do it myself.
But I still want to be a killer.
I would have never forgiven myself.
And then we have the most incredible sex.
No. They put me to sleep.
Would you like the key back?
Tio. You're removed. You book the work, you collect the fees...
I come to you at nine. I say I want to be a killer. What kind of kid makes a career choice like that unless they have something on their mind.
I live for the day that the blood of the son of bitch who did my parents drips in the gutter. Stop playing the innocent with me. You know this. Forever.
If you do, you would never have let me get involved in the first place.
Now let's see what good boys you can be.
Hola Pepe. I guess the boys gave me away.
I should do a lot of things.
Your ears are better than my eyes.
I want you exactly where you are.
You know the thing about sharks.
I'm not going to kill you.
What would you like to talk about?
You really want to do this?
Nothing much. A little swimming, fed the fish.
That's a hard one for me.
Now you know something else about me.
Tio. Could be anyone. You're seeing things that aren't there.
How many people did you kill in revenge for your boy's death? How many? And you're going to give me a lecture about revenge?
No Mama. One thing at a time.
I was just sitting here, looking out the window. And I thought...where are you?
So we're seeing the same sky.
And I'm happy to hear yours.
What does the sister of Ryan have to do with this?
I'd like to speak to the agent in charge of the TAG killings.
This won't take long. Hands up.
Talking about covering all your bases. Your chair is pressure wired. You move your ass one inch you don't have one anymore.
I know what you're thinking. Maybe yes a bluff, maybe no. But you have to figure yes, given what you know about me.
This wasn't what I had in mind for myself when I was a kid. I wanted to be on the other side of things.
This is the last time I was happy.
The next day they were dead. He killed them.
I didn't know how else to find him.
It took you a long time.
What else do I have to be? I have no one. I did. Until this morning.
And now I want to finish it.
Yes you can. He's protected by your government.
You're going to have to try harder.
I found this on your table inside.
I know this sounds harsh. But until I get what I want, you'll go to a funeral a week. And you will begin to feel what I have felt all these years.
When your dinner's ready, the timer on it will have expired. Then you can get to work.
You guys ever been to New Orleans?
I didn't know if you took sugar and cream, so I got one of each.
You designed the house at eight seven six Magnolia.
I would love to see the plans of this house.
For something you can never understand. The love I had for my parents. And you killed that.
Actually Don Luis...you are exactly where I want you to be.
I know where to find you.
Because I love you Fabio. Like a brother.
Can you believe this guy Marco?
Ten year old bastards stealing apples from the carts in the market.
I don't even want to count.
I'm not going to talk you out of it, am I cabron?
I'm gonna hold you to that. You bastard.
OK. Enough of this sentimental bullshit. Next we'll be crying like two old women. Come on! One last drink, huh?
Fabio. Fabio Maria Restrepo. But I don't understand? Why come here with this?
String? Now we are talking about string? I'm not a tailor.
And this is what you traveled all the way down here to tell me?
OK OK. What would you want?
I had nothing to do with this. I swear.
Idiot! I told you. Everyone dead.
You screwed up the first time.
Marco! What the hell's going on???
I beat you bitch! You can't kill me! I am unkillable!
I don't understand you. You should have been dead a long time ago.
And because of that, you have ruined your whole life to try to kill me?
I cannot be killed. I do the killing. Not the other way around.
And I love you Don Luis. Like a brother.
Luis, I'm going to be honest with you. You remember I had that operation?
Since then, I'm not a hundred percent. And you can't do this thing if you're not a hundred percent. I'm tired.
You know how many times we should have been dead?
Neither do I. But you gotta think.
It's yours. It's not my thing any more.
I'll always be there for you Luis.
And I'm going to miss you.
Adios Marco. Make sure he doesn't get in too much trouble.
This bastard thinks I'm an idiot.
Listen to me my darling. Just in case of anything. This...
This is your passport. Do you understand?
You find yourself alone? You go to the address on this card. Show it to the man at the front gate.
You don't have to understand. You just have to listen, and remember.
And this will keep you safe.
The Cataleya orchid. It comes from one place on Earth. Our place.
Adios Don Fabio. I'll do my best.
You in the kitchen. You, the bedroom. You, the back.
What do you mean so what? You take a kid, teach them, they have value.
Are you stupid or what? Here.
Here's twenty asshole. Go do your job.
I was at your confirmation. My name is Marco, and I was a very good friend of your father. I see he gave you his medal.
Some things are too complicated for a kid to understand. This is one of them. But I am going to try explain it and make it very simple for you. So you understand.
Of course you do. He was your father's best friend since they're kids. He's like an Uncle to you.
This house, the food you eat, the clothes you wear. Even your school fees. All this comes from Don Luis. You know that?
But when someone is good to you and you are not good to them back, then bad things happen. Things like...
I know you are a smart girl. You do well in school. So I know this is not too complicated for you to understand. Am I right?
Good. Now, your father had something that belonged to Don Luis. A little thing. No bigger than...
This. Maybe it was in this.
Do you know what I am talking about?
Excellent. Do you know where it is?
Well, if you give it to me, Don Luis will be very grateful. And very generous. He will make sure that you are clothed, fed, and sent to the very best school. You will have everything you want.
But if you don't give it to him, he will be very unhappy. And you see what happens when he is not happy, yes?
So why don't you just give that little thing which belongs to him.
And in this life, smart girls get everything they want. What do you want Cat?
Just tell me sweetheart...what do you want?
North! Go North! We're cutting off the southern streets!
We got her! Close the net!
First for fucking up your shot.
You went to school with his brother in law. What was his name? Emilio?
I have a problem. And we think Fabio's kid is behind it.
So you do have a memory.
You don't tell me what I want to know by the count of three, you scum sucking lowlife prick, your memory will be permanently disabled.
You will take up positions here...
And here. And here. You must expect the unexpected. She is like mist under a door, like a mouse in the wall. She will never attack straight on. You will not see her, until it is too late.
We would prefer she be taken alive.
You four! Get the armored Mercedes!
Don Luis! This way! Everyone to their positions!
Wait for my call. Either she is dead, or we have her far enough away so you can make it to the garage. Take the van. The armor is so thick nothing short of an atomic bomb can penetrate it.
That's the first time you ever said that.
You know what bitch? I loved killing your father. He was a coward! And you know what else?
You two here! That door opens...
I will hold here! Run! Run!
Do it! Do it you bitch! Isn't this the moment you've been waiting for?
Hola. We want to see Don Fabio.
They said he's not home yet.
It's been a long day for her.
And the five hundred dollars allowance for the first six months.
Hey kid. You know what time it is?
It's late, and this is not the kind of place a kid should be hanging out. What are you doing here?
There's a girl looking for you.
It's not that sort of thing. She's eight.
I couldn't even get ten bucks for her in the street.

As she moves through the maze of ducts. On the way, she peers through the grates in each ceiling, down into one cell after another, catching various views of inmates asleep as she passes over them. Until she comes to a ventilation fan blocking the way. The fan blades go round and round.
Where a half dozen women are doing laundry by an open tap.
In the windshield of the jeep, staring at her.

She stands at the edge of the busy thoroughfare, and looks around. She is in the heart of the city. Where tall office buildings, compete with graceful, classical mansions. In the distance, she sees the hillsides, covered with the twinkling lights of the favelas, two miles, and a world away.
And you say you have something for us?
Did he tell you what this is?
You must have done something pretty important to get the royal treatment little lady.
To provide a safe, healthy nurturing environment where young women can get the education they will need to meet the challenges of that amazing adventure called life.
And give you twenty a week for incidentals.
Girls, this is your new classmate.
Well, 'very tired', I'm sure you want to lay down and rest your little head?
A week. Peace has it's price, y'know what I'm saying?
Hola chica, where are we wanting to go today?
Chicago is not next door, you know.
I'm not interested in a girl right now.
Madonna! I thought you were dead!
When was the last time you slept?
Well good. A growing body needs sleep. When I was your age I would sleep half the day. I don't know if it helped with the growing, but I was well rested for whatever came after.
No one who is still alive.
You are very talented. Is this what you want to be? An artist?

The good news is your father bought you your life with what he gave you. The bad news is Don Luis was playing both sides, and has disappeared. You tore down everything he spent years building up with that little chip. It is something he will not forget.
I am trying to educate you.
She's still in a bit of shock.
We'll get all this stuff, then go over to this little place I know down on Maxwell street for some of these hot dogs the Polish people make here.
Chica. Any idiot can be a killer.
You want me to teach you to be a killer? No problema. I'll teach you. But you'll be dead in five years.
If you want to be a killer, and survive, you have to be a smart one. You have to know things besides how to pull a trigger.
Now what's it going to be?
Can't wait to see you Cara.
You remember the guy who was in the news for running that Ponzi scheme about a year ago?

He disappeared fifty billion dollars. The money was never recovered. Skipped out and bought himself citizenship on some shit hole of a Caribbean island that calls itself a country with no extradition laws. Lot of very pissed off people lost everything.
How long has this been going on?
The paper says twenty two. All like this. Tell me why.
Since you're a kid, you don't do anything for no reason. Don't play dumb, it insults me.
It's not just you in this. It's me, Mama.
I watch your ass. Each and every job, I vet, I double vet. For every one I book you, I turn down five, ten. I promised to keep you safe. I KEEP YOU SAFE. Cataleya.
Sure. Of course. But the way you're playing it. They even have a name for you. The Tag killer.
You said you would stop the writing!
Seven people slaughtered in a Miami bar. I knew one of them. Years ago, in school.
I don't like it. This is getting too close.
And you are so blinded by your need for revenge that you are not seeing things that are. The handwriting is on the wall Cara.
Cara. It's time to get a life, before you run out of time. Here.
Maybe this will help you understand what I am telling you.
You have your mother's beautiful eyes. Don't be scared. This is your home.
Cara. You will come home for lunch.
That was such a nice surprise.
I think she's going to be OK.
Normally we don't accept students in the middle of the academic year, but under the circumstances, losing her parents in that tragic car accident...
These are the school supplies you'll need.
Of course. See you Monday Cataleya.
A car parking. And DANNY DELANEY, preoccupied, a pleasant, easy going, good looker at 28, closes the door, and walks to the entrance of his low slung apartment building. He enters.
So then I suggest, y'know, we buy some things to spice it up a bit.
A garter belt, some of those stockings that come up the thigh...it's fourteen years. Know what I mean?
That's all you have to say? Oops?
Wanna laugh you crazy bitch? I'll give you something to laugh about!
Yeah. No matter how much you like steak, sometime a lamb chop is not a bad thing.
No license, no registration. No ID except a library card. Well Ms...
Valarie Phillips in addition to all that...you're being charged here with DUI, destruction of police property, driving the wrong way on a two way street...
Unless you can think of anything else you should be charged with.
Take her in the back, lock her up, put a cup of coffee in with her.
Here we go. Says here you're not expected until tomorrow.
Go take a look at the breaker on the ventilation system, will ya?
Tell it to the judge at your hearing in ten days.
Nothing. Fill out the forms and you can go.
Really. We need to get things organized. But don't worry, the judge will send you back, for sure.
You're lucky no one was hurt.
US Marshal Warren. We have Gennaro Rizzo here on an overnight.
Rizzo. The Mafia guy? On the way to testify up in San Francisco tomorrow? They didn't notify you?
One man here. Two more outside the front door. Everyone else on the perimeter, in teams of two.
It's a caffeine kinda night fellas.
It was after the fact. I didn't think...
OK! That's it. No one in or out!
The cops look around the roof.
Do it. Now. No one in or out.
I want to see paper on everyone in and out of the station in the last twenty four hours.
And I want the tapes from the security cameras.
He tilted the camera just enough so the angle would catch the guard, not who was holding him.
Twenty two murders in four years all with the same M.O. The word, the flower. He's sending a message, for sure. And I'm beginning to think it's not to us.
And we're not getting anywhere with it, are we?
If the message is not for us, let's make sure the one it's intended for gets it. I want you to put it out to the press. Splash it across every newspaper, every magazine.
The most recent, was done to keep him from talking. Alexa Milshinova...
...made a career of getting intimate with big stakes gamblers out of Vegas and then taking them off and sending them to meet their maker.
...tried to take over the heroin trade in Houston from...

The Gemini cartel. Their crimes are self explanatory, if you can read. Now I know some of you are thinking whoever is doing this makes less work for mother. And since there's no collateral damage, why are we wasting valuable manpower and resources on the case? And since until now, there has never been a clue to go on, why go on?
We have one. As we go to the video tape.
We can't see the assassin, but we can see...
The time. 2 AM. Which means our perp was in the station at...I don't have to spell it out for you.
These are the names, phone numbers and addresses of everyone with a pulse who entered that police station before two AM. Cops, criminals, clerks, janitors.
FBI special agent Jack Ross. I'm lead agent on a case. A serial killer we call the tag killer.
Marks his victims with a flower.
When I try to access information, I get stuck with a CIA Access denied folder. I understand you were the station chief down there when this rash of murders with the same MO...
Lovely. So if there is no booking record, how did we get the name?
It's not a lot to go on. But put them in the data base and let's see what matches.
I want a trace put on an incoming transmission!
We got her! I want SWAT there!
She's not here. Lock the building down!
Where the hell did she go?
No one in or out! Lock this place down! Anyone?
All units! Converge on the garage.
Look under every car. In every trunk!!!
Just so you know, all this? Being so smart? Covering all your bases?
And all this? All these clues...they weren't for us. They were for him.
And you figured sooner or later we would make this public.
You sent him a message. He sent you one back.
By a part of the government I have no way of reaching. It's CIA. I don't know why. But there's no getting through it, under it, around it, believe me, I've tried.
Look, let's put all our cards on the table here. I've met this woman. The killer.
She will kill a member of my family every day until I have none.
Do I look like I could make something like that up?
So? What should I do now?
She says you either give her what she wants or she is going to redecorate your office.
She says she's using seven point six two steel jacketed armor piercing shells. And you have ten seconds to give her the address.
You can't. But I can assure you that if you don't give her the address you will be number twenty four on her hit parade. Trust me on this one.
She asked you to keep this conversation strictly confidential.
Thank you. Because honestly I didn't know how I was going to explain you splattered all over your walls.
We don't really have anything to charge you with.
Is it Rizzo? Was it an assassination? Are there any clues?
But we're the only ones with the information.
We ID'd everyone who came in and out of the police station for the twenty four hours preceding the incident. The only one that we could not verify was a...
Valarie Phillips. Picked up for drunk driving four hours before the hit on Rizzo.
We ran the prints in the data base.
A library card. The only ID she had was a library card.
No ma'am everything is under control. We just need you to stay inside. May we have a look around?
Ross. We're picking something up off that kid's phone.
Yes it has Marco. How's the hand?
Should've let us relocate you to Arizona instead of New Orleans.
I brought you the morning paper.
Coincidence? Twenty two times? A flower that only grows in one place on earth? That used to be the calling card of...what was his name? Your former partner? The one who did your wet work?
Because when we find the end of a string we like to know where it begins.

Don Luis. Let's cut to the chase here, OK? When the Agency extracted your ass from Colombia fifteen years ago, and set you up here, we let you resume your business when what we should have done was lock you up for life. In exchange, you were supposed to keep the information flowing.
Not much, and not for a very long time.

No. What I traveled all the way down here to tell you, is there's a limit to our patience. The CIA is not an amusement park. There are no free rides. Everyone pays their way. And you, my friend, have not.
And Don Luis, don't play the innocent with us. It won't sit well with my bosses if we find out you had anything to do with this.

Listen, Agent Ross, we don't give out any type of information over the phone. So what I suggest is you file a formal request with the agency for any information you might want. And I'll be more than happy to get back to you as soon as I can.
You understand, I only agreed to this meeting out of professional courtesy.
The President wanting us to reach out to you folks on the domestic side, and all that pie in the sky crap.
The truth is, I really can't help you at all.
I'd go to the police. Now if you'll excuse me, I have a meeting...
What does she think this is?
How can I be sure once she has the address she won't kill me anyway?
You show up whenever you want to...
Wouldn't you like to go to dinner sometime?
So let's pop in a DVD and you can spend the night here?
No. I just want to get...I don't know...
Wow! Just what I always wanted.
No. No. I mean, a gift from you.
Of course I do. But can't we talk a little first?
OK. OK. I get it. You want to protect yourself. I understand.
I got that. I'm not in a hurry.

If you can't talk about? That's OK. But, you know, if someone hurt you before...like a broken heart or something. I'm not responsible for that. I just want want to be here for you. To know a little about what's inside.
I didn't know if you like your eggs over easy or scrambled, so I made...
And I think about her all day long.
I knew you were the perfect guy to talk about this with.
Ryan, I'm twenty eight. I met someone who I want to be with.
It's not even a whole picture. I took it while she was asleep.
Haven't you been listening to me?
I just feel like, maybe, I'm invading her privacy or something.
Oh my god! I can't believe it!
In my apartment. Looking out the window.
Yes. I'm so happy to hear your voice.
You know it's so crazy. I was just sitting here, looking at your picture, thinking "I'd wish I could call her." And you called.
I'm sorry. I know I shouldn't have. But I have nothing to remember you by, except this little stuffed...
I took a picture of you while you were sleeping. With my phone.
Jen. I'm sorry. Really. I didn't mean to offend you.
His sister. I didn't want to..it's just...I wanted to contact you. I wanted to...
Shari, that's Ryan's sister...she works at Police headquarters...
Can I have a cup of coffee?
Jen...I...uh...I'm so sorry. I didn't mean...are you OK?
FBI headquarters. I didn't tell them anything...besides...
Will I ever see you again?
If there is ever a chance. I want you to know...I could love you.
Holding two very full shopping bags.
She wakes with a start. To find Danny standing there with a breakfast tray, and a big smile on his face.
Anyone else? The barking would only have stopped when their screaming began. You spoil them.
If that's what you want to call it.
Did you get the beans I like?
Not the one in the short bottle.
I hate that other one, the chili they use sucks. Did you see your uncle?
We're going to church for Easter.
As always. You should, you know.
You could start with that one. It would make us very happy.
Cataleya. No one knows what happens tomorrow, next year is a long time away. How was your trip?
You work too much. I keep telling that to Emilio. The girl should have a life while she is still young enough to enjoy it. You should take a vacation. Go some place warm. With a nice beach.
Hey! I pay to see more, not less.
Put a drop of blood in there and they'll be your biggest admirers.
Bring extra security in for the night.
And make sure we're shut down tight.
Whatever they paid you, I'll double it!
Please. I'll give you anything you want. Don't kill me!
Willie you are such a perv.
It was in the post box this morning.
Yes sir. Have a good night, sir.
There are already guys in the garden and guys out back. I want you three upstairs, two on the roof.
Well, there was a little problem.
I have fifty bucks on this shot.
It's a long time. My memory...
Look Marco. I gotta be honest with you. Everyone knows you guys were playing a double game, and when the shit went down, you were the only ones who got out of it clean.
Yeah. For rats. Now get the fuck out, and let me take my shot.
Seriously. This comes from the heart. OK?

The girl comes over, strips down, rocks your world, gets dressed, asks for nothing. Leaves. The only thing she doesn't do is bring the pizza and beer. You are living my dream. And you want to go and fuck it up with love?
Hey come on. It's me. Since first grade. You and me?
Whoa...total babe-age! When do I meet the future Mrs. Delaney?
Dude. That is such a no brainer.
You're doing it for love Shari.
You know, if you weren't my brother's best friend...
Up to you Danny. I do it all the time. Photo goes in here. Bangs around the National Data base looking for a match. Bingo.
Hey guys, I haven't got all day.

Replies.Didascalie: (holds her hand on the send button on THE COMPUTER)

Replies.Reply: We need a common base, so let's try size...
You either leave immediately young lady or I am going to call the police.
